instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Hi there,

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight.

I have 50 volts on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 

i've tested pretty much all of the backlight circuit and it seems fine. <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> seems to have everything too.

any ideas where to go next?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
there was also a small amount fo liquid near <CAPACITOR>C5801</CAPACITOR> which i notice has a prob point under for <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> but it's present on pin 8 of the LCD connector at 1.5v

the other liquid damage was only on the SSD but i wonder if this could affect anything with backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: 50 volts on backlight output means it doesn't see a load or the computer is not seeing the light of the screen. Likely a bad screen, screen cable, or LCD connector Have you tried a known good 2015 13" Retina display? 2013/14 will not work!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Hi John, with the original screen i get 0 volts on backlight output so i swapped to a KG screen and i can see the question mark folder with a light. I tried another screen to be sure and same thing... confused!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: If with the kg screen you get 50 volts, I would say bad LCD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Okay thanks - will get to that shortly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Is there any way to tell for sure that it’s the connector - visually it looks great and I’m sure all of the voltages are present. I guess Pin 1 BCK light output being 50v can justify the connector replacement but just want to double check?
